paper.title: Practical Threshold RSA Signatures without a Trusted Dealer
paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: We propose a threshold RSA scheme which is as efficient as the fastest previous threshold RSA scheme (by Shoup), but where two assumptions needed in Shoupu0027s and in previous schemes can be dropped, namely that the modulus must be a product of safe primes and that a trusted dealer generates the keys. The robustness (but not the unforgeability) of our scheme depends on a new intractability assumption, in addition to security of the underlying standard RSA scheme.
